ir_curator_required: Curator Fields that all studies should have
ir_curator: Curator Fields that should be in metadata
airr_desc: AIRR Description

Identifier for the repertoire object. This identifier should be globally unique so that repertoires from multiple studies can be combined together without conflict. The repertoire_id is used to link other AIRR data to a Repertoire. Specifically, the Rearrangements Schema includes repertoire_id for referencing the specific Repertoire for that Rearrangement
Unique ID assigned by study registry
Descriptive study title
airr_example: Effects of sun light exposure of the Treg repertoire

airr_desc: Type of study design
Generic study description
List of criteria for inclusion/exclusion for the study
airr_example: Include: Clinical P. falciparum infection; Exclude: Seropositive for HIV

airr_desc: Funding agencies and grant numbers
Full contact information of the data collector, i.e. the person who is legally responsible for data collection and release. This should include an e-mail address.
Department of data collector
Institution and institutional address of data collector
airr_example: School of Medicine, Unseen University, Ankh-Morpork, Disk World

airr_desc: Full contact information of the data depositor, i.e. the person submitting the data to a repository. This is supposed to be a short-lived and technical role until the submission is relased.
Publications describing the rationale and/or outcome of the study
Keywords describing properties of one or more data sets in a study
Subject ID assigned by submitter, unique within study
TRUE for libraries in which the diversity has been synthetically generated (e.g. phage display)
Binomial designation of subject's species
Biological sex of subject
Specific age or lower boundary of age range.
Upper boundary of age range or equal to age_min for specific age. This field should only be null if age_min is null.
unit of age range

Event in the study schedule to which `Age` refers. For NCBI BioSample this MUST be `sampling`. For other implementations submitters need to be aware that there is currently no mechanism to encode to potential delta between `Age event` and `Sample collection time`, hence the chosen events should be in temporal proximity.
Broad geographic origin of ancestry (continent)
airr_example: list of continents, mixed or unknown

airr_desc: Ethnic group of subject (defined as cultural/language-based membership)
airr_example: English, Kurds, Manchu, Yakuts (and other fields from Wikipedia)

airr_desc: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH)
airr_example: White, American Indian or Alaska Native, Black, Asian, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, Other

airr_desc: Non-human designation of the strain or breed of animal used
Subject ID to which `Relation type` refers
Relation between subject and `linked_subjects`, can be genetic or environmental (e.g.exposure)
Designation of study arm to which the subject is assigned to
Diagnosis of subject
Time duration between initial diagnosis and current intervention
Stage of disease at current intervention

ir_full: Prior therapies for primary disease under study
airr_full: Prior therapies for primary disease under study
airr_desc: List of all relevant previous therapies applied to subject for treatment of `Diagnosis`
Antigen, vaccine or drug applied to subject at this intervention
Description of intervention
Medical history of subject that is relevant to assess the course of disease and/or treatment

Identifier for the sample processing object. This field should be unique within the repertoire. This field can be used to uniquely identify the combination of sample, cell processing, nucleic acid processing and sequencing run information for the repertoire.
Sample ID assigned by submitter, unique within study
The way the sample was obtained, e.g. fine-needle aspirate, organ harvest, peripheral venous puncture
The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood
The anatomic location of the tissue, e.g. Inguinal, femur
Histopathologic evaluation of the sample
Time point at which sample was taken, relative to `Collection time event`
Event in the study schedule to which `Sample collection time` relates to
Name and address of the entity providing the sample
Enzymatic digestion and/or physical methods used to isolate cells from sample
airr_example: Collagenase A/Dnase I digested, followed by Percoll gradient

airr_desc: Commonly-used designation of isolated cell population
airr_example: CL_0000972, class switched memory B cell

airr_desc: List of cellular markers and their expression levels used to isolate the cell population

Binomial designation of the species from which the analyzed cells originate. Typically, this value should be identical to `organism`, if which case it SHOULD NOT be set explicitly. Howver, there are valid experimental setups in which the two might differ, e.g. chimeric animal models. If set, this key will overwrite the `organism` information for all lower layers of the schema.
TRUE if single cells were isolated into separate compartments
Total number of cells that went into the experiment

ir_full: Number of cells per sequencing reaction
airr_full: Number of cells per sequencing reaction
airr_desc: Number of cells for each biological replicate
TRUE if cells were cryo-preserved between isolation and further processing
Relative amount of viable cells after preparation and (if applicable) thawing
Description of the procedure used for marker-based isolation or enrich cells
airr_example: Cells were stained with fluorochrome labeled antibodies and then sorted on a FlowMerlin (CE) cytometer

airr_desc: Description of the methods applied to the sample including cell preparation/ isolation/enrichment and nucleic acid extraction. This should closely mirror the Materials and methods section in the manuscript
The class of nucleic acid that was used as primary starting material for the following procedures
Description and results of the quality control performed on the template material
Amount of template that went into the process
Generic type of library generation
Description of processes applied to substrate to obtain a library that is ready for sequencing
When using a library generation protocol from a commercial provider, provide the protocol version number
Designation of the target locus according to IMGT nomencleature
Position of the most distal nucleotide templated by the forward primer or primer mix
Position of the most proximal nucleotide templated by the reverse primer or primer mix

To be considered `complete`, the procedure used for library construction MUST generate sequences that 1) include the first V segment codon that encodes the mature polypeptide chain (i.e. after the leader sequence) and 2) include the last complete codon of the J segment (i.e. 1 bp 5' of the J->C splice site) and 3) provide sequence information for all positions between 1) and 2). To be considered `complete & untemplated`, the sections of the sequences defined in points 1) to 3) of the previous sentence MUST be untemplated, i.e. MUST NOT overlap with the primers used in library preparation.
Describes the mode of linkage if a method was used which physically links nucleic acids derived from distinct loci in a single-cell context.
ID of sequencing run assigned by the sequencing facility
Number of usable reads for analysis
Designation of sequencing instrument used
Read length in bases for each direction
Name and address of sequencing facility
Date of sequencing run
Name, manufacturer, order and lot numbers of sequencing kit
File format for the raw reads or sequences
File name for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing
Read direction for the raw reads or sequences. The first file in paired-read sequencing
File name for the second file in paired-read sequencing
Read direction for the second file in paired-read sequencing
Identifier for the data processing object.
If true, indicates this is the primary or default data processing for the repertoire and its rearrangments. If false, indicates this is a secondary or additional data processing.
Version number and / or date, include company pipelines
How paired end reads were assembled into a single receptor sequence
How sequences were removed from (4) based on base quality scores
How primers were identified in the sequences, were they removed/masked/etc?
The method used for combining multiple sequences from (4) into a single sequence in (5)
General description of how QC is performed
Source of germline V(D)J genes with version number or date accessed.
Identifier for machine-readable PROV model of analysis provenance

Unique query sequence identifier within the file. Most often this will be the input sequence header or a substring thereof, but may also be a custom identifier defined by the tool in cases where query sequences have been combined in some fashion prior to alignment.

The query nucleotide sequence. Usually, this is the unmodified input sequence, which may be reverse complemented if necessary. In some cases, this field may contain consensus sequences or other types of collapsed input sequences if these steps are performed prior to alignment.
Amino acid translation of the query nucleotide sequence.

True if the alignment is on the opposite strand (reverse complemented) with respect to the query sequence. If True then all output data, such as alignment coordinates and sequences, are based on the reverse complement of 'sequence'.
True if the V(D)J sequence is predicted to be productive.
True if the V and J segment alignments are in-frame.
True if the aligned sequence contains a stop codon.
Gene locus (chain type). For example, IGH, IGI, IGK, IGL, TRA, TRB, TRD, or TRG.
V gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database, such as IMGT/GENE-DB, the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHV4-59*01).
D gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database, such as IMGT/GENE-DB, the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHD3-10*01).
J gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database, such as IMGT/GENE-DB, the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHJ4*02).
C region gene with allele. If referring to a known reference sequence in a database, such as IMGT/GENE-DB, the relevant gene/allele nomenclature should be followed (e.g., IGHM*01).
Aligned portion of query sequence, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers, such as IMGT-gaps. Typically, this will include only the V(D)J region, but that is not a requirement.
Amino acid translation of the aligned query sequence.

Assembled, aligned, full-length inferred germline sequence spanning the same region as the sequence_alignment field (typically the V(D)J region) and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).
Amino acid translation of the assembled germline sequence.
Junction region nucleotide sequence, where the junction is defined as the CDR3 plus the two flanking conserved codons.
Junction region amino acid sequence.

vquest: P3'V or N-REGION or N1-REGION or P5'D or P5'D1 or P5'J
airr_desc: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the V and D segments or V and J segments.
Amino acid translation of the np1 field.

vquest: P3'D or P3'D1 or N2-REGION or P5'J or P5'D2
airr_desc: Nucleotide sequence of the combined N/P region between the D and J segments.
Amino acid translation of the np2 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR1 region.
Amino acid translation of the cdr1 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR2 region.
Amino acid translation of the cdr2 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned CDR3 region.
Amino acid translation of the cdr3 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR1 region.
Amino acid translation of the fwr1 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR2 region.
Amino acid translation of the fwr2 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR3 region.
Amino acid translation of the fwr3 field.
Nucleotide sequence of the aligned FWR4 region.
Amino acid translation of the fwr4 field.
Alignment score for the V gene.
Fractional identity for the V gene alignment.
V gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the V gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.
CIGAR string for the V gene alignment.
Alignment score for the D gene alignment.
Fractional identity for the D gene alignment.
D gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the D gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.
CIGAR string for the D gene alignment.
Alignment score for the J gene alignment.
Fractional identity for the J gene alignment.
J gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the J gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.
CIGAR string for the J gene alignment.
Alignment score for the C gene alignment.
Fractional identity for the C gene alignment.
C gene alignment E-value, p-value, likelihood, probability or other similar measure of support for the C gene assignment as defined by the alignment tool.
CIGAR string for the C gene alignment.
Start position of the V segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
End position of the V segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment start position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment end position in the V gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Start position in the V segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
End position in the V segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
Start position of the D segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
End position of the D segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment start position in the D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment end position in the D gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Start position of the D segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
End position of the D segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
Start position of the J segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
End position of the J segment in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment start position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Alignment end position in the J gene reference sequence (1-based closed interval).
Start position of the J segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
End position of the J segment in both the sequence_alignment and germline_alignment fields (1-based closed interval).
CDR1 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
CDR1 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
CDR2 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
CDR2 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
CDR3 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
CDR3 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR1 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR1 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR2 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR2 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR3 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR3 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR4 start position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
FWR4 end position in the query sequence (1-based closed interval).
Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the V segment, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.
Amino acid translation of the v_sequence_alignment field.
Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the D segment, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.
Amino acid translation of the d_sequence_alignment field.
Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the J segment, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.
Amino acid translation of the j_sequence_alignment field.
Aligned portion of query sequence assigned to the constant region, including any indel corrections or numbering spacers.
Amino acid translation of the c_sequence_alignment field.
Aligned V gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the v_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).
Amino acid translation of the v_germline_alignment field.
Aligned D gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the d_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).
Amino acid translation of the d_germline_alignment field.
Aligned J gene germline sequence spanning the same region as the j_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).
Amino acid translation of the j_germline_alignment field.
Aligned constant region germline sequence spanning the same region as the c_sequence_alignment field and including the same set of corrections and spacers (if any).
Amino acid translation of the c_germline_aligment field.
Number of nucleotides in the junction sequence.
Number of amino acids in the junction sequence.
Number of nucleotides between the V and D segments or V and J segments.
Number of nucleotides between the D and J segments.
Number of untemplated nucleotides 5' of the D segment.
Number of untemplated nucleotides 3' of the D segment.
Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the V segment.
Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the D segment.
Number of palindromic nucleotides 3' of the D segment.
Number of palindromic nucleotides 5' of the J segment.
Number of reads contributing to the (UMI) consensus for this sequence. For example, the sum of the number of reads for all UMIs that contribute to the query sequence.

Copy number or number of duplicate observations for the query sequence. For example, the number of UMIs sharing an identical sequence or the number of identical observations of this sequence absent UMIs.
Valid sequence_id that was determined by experimental or computational means to be associated with the current Rearrangement on the cellular level.
Identifier defining the cell of origin for the query sequence.
Clonal cluster assignment for the query sequence.
Identifier for the Rearrangement object. May be identical to sequence_id, but will usually be a univerally unique record locator for database applications.
Identifier to the associated repertoire in study metadata.

Identifier for the sample processing object. This field should be unique within the repertoire. This field can be used to uniquely identify the combination of sample, cell processing, nucleic acid processing and sequencing run information for the repertoire.
Identifier for the data processing object.
Source of germline V(D)J genes with version number or date accessed.
